result.eng: He is two years old.

result.ponchtml: Tá mé sa gcéad ḃliainI am in the first year.

result.eng: Where were you on holiday this year?

result.eng: I have not had a holiday for a few years.

result.eng: I've been in the city for ten years.

result.eng: She is three years older than me.

result.orig: Tá sí trí bliana níos sine ná mise

result.eng: She's been in Chicago for years and years.

result.orig: In Chicago atá sí leis na blianta fada
result.html: In Chicago atá sí leis na blianta fadaShe's been in Chicago for years and years.

result.eng: I went to County Kerry last year on my holiday.

result.eng: I go swimming in the sea ever day of the year. Even in the winter?

result.eng: Eimear is seven years (old) and Dara is ten years (old).

result.eng: I'm not married but I've been going out with someone for three years now.

result.eng: We've been living in the house now for six years and we're very happy with it.
result.ga: Táimid inár gcónaí sa teach anois le sé bliana agus táimid an-sásta leis

result.eng: That doesn't happen as often now as it used to a few years ago.

result.eng: They have been living in America for years.

result.eng: When he was 11 years of age, the whole family moved to France.

result.eng: Some ten years ago I got up from bed in a small apartment.

result.eng: The attacks were apparently being planned by Osama Bin Laden's soldiers for several years.

result.eng: They carried out an invasion on Iraq one and half year after that.

result.eng: I was reminded of my first visit to America, many years ago.

result.eng: Jamie was four years old, no more, no less.

result.eng: He was so short of sense as a child five years younger than him.

result.eng: We depend on him for food all year round.
